name: F. Curse
statement:
You are given two arrays of integers: a_1, a_2,
ldots, a_n and b_1, b_2,
ldots, b_m.You need to determine if it is possible to transform array a
into array b using the following operation several (possibly, zero)
times. Among all non-empty subarrays^{
text{ }} of a, choose any with the maximum sum, and replace this
subarray with an arbitrary non-empty integer array.If it is possible,
you need to construct any possible sequence of operations. Constraint:
in your answer, the sum of the lengths of the arrays used as
replacements must not exceed n + m across all operations. The numbers
must not exceed 10^9 in absolute value.^{
text{ }}An array a is a subarray of an array b if a can be obtained from
b by the deletion of several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the
beginning and several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the end.
